decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base and game plan while establishing a fast and aggressive board presence. It utilizes disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker along with powerful equipment like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Rishadan Port further disrupts the opponent's resources, making it difficult for them to execute their game plan effectively. The deck aims to establish early dominance and control the game through a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on efficiently searching for and assembling the Dark Depths-Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in one turn. Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt opponents' strategies while Sylvan Scrying and Crop Rotation help find the combo pieces quickly. Pithing Needle and Ghost Quarter add additional disruption and removal options. The deck also includes protection with Sylvan Safekeeper and acceleration with Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal. The Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Bojuka Bog provide additional utility and synergy with the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock down their ability to play spells, while quickly deploying threats that can end the game swiftly. By using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to capitalize on the opponent's inability to cast spells effectively. Additionally, cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Goblin Rabblemaster provide additional pressure and protection. The deck's aggressive strategy is complemented by powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, Scion of Urza to maintain board presence and card advantage.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, backed up by disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes versatile threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler, enabling it to adapt to different matchups. With a mix of card draw and tempo plays, the deck aims to control the board while maintaining a fast clock to overwhelm opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize a fast-paced combination of spells and mana acceleration to generate a high storm count, ultimately leading to a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens finish. The deck relies heavily on cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to quickly ramp up mana for explosive turns, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, supported by mana acceleration like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponents' spells, while Wasteland and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth disrupt their mana base. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large, efficient threats and disrupt their game plan with targeted removal and disruption spells. With a focused game plan and strong creatures, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and control the board. With a mix of card selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out games before they can stabilize. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's three colors.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, supported by disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze. It also includes powerful removal in Lightning Bolt and disruption in Spell Pierce. The mana base is built around utilizing Wasteland to disrupt opponent's mana base while efficiently casting spells with fetch lands and dual lands. The key strategy is to apply pressure with early creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan to finish the game quickly.

The key strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Aether Vial to slow down the opponent's spells, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. Stoneforge Mystic and equipment cards like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull provide additional threats and value. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and Phyrexian Revoker to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and overwhelm them with efficient threats.

This deck is focused on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Thespian's Stage to search for and copy Dark Depths. Thoughtseize, Duress, and Abrupt Decay help disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Pithing Needle can shut down key cards or abilities. The deck also includes a variety of lands to support the combo, along with protection from removal spells in the form of Sylvan Safekeeper. The goal is to quickly create a 20/20 Marit Lage token and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

This UWx Control deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's plays through card draw, counterspells, and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It uses powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to generate advantage and stability in the late game. The deck also features cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict to clear the board of threats when needed. With a mix of control elements and card advantage engines, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantages.

The main concept of this Aluren combo Legacy deck is to use Aluren to cast creatures for free, creating a loop with Cavern Harpy and other creatures like Shardless Agent and Baleful Strix to disrupt opponents and control the board. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides card advantage and control, while Deathrite Shaman helps with mana ramp and disruption. The deck aims to control the game and win through its combo pieces and disruption.

The main goal in this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible. This involves using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to search for Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Once you have both of these lands on the battlefield, you can merge them to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token, which can end the game in just a few turns. In addition, cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle are included to disrupt your opponent's game plan and protect your combo.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by using cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Hanweir Garrison and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and lock the opponent out of the game by preventing them from casting their spells effectively. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Umezawa's Jitte adds further disruption and versatility to the deck's game plan, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and strategies.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board and disrupting the opponent with a high density of cheap countermagic and removal spells. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Delver of Secrets to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The deck also has access to powerful utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive, disruptive, and aggressive in order to secure victories in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and lock pieces like Blood Moon, Humility, and Energy Field. The deck aims to stabilize the game with cards like Supreme Verdict and Rest in Peace, while setting up win conditions with Luminarch Ascension and Helm of Obedience. By leveraging efficient answers and powerful threats, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a slower paced, control-oriented game.
